title: folder on my email address could not be found, so filter on folder disabled
content:
two errors.

1. the folder the guardian on myemailaddress@gmail.com could not be found, so filters associated with this folder will be disabled. Verify that the folder exists, and the filters point to a valid destination folder

2.ditto....different folder....Linux.org on myemailadress etc etc.

In my research I came across a suggestion to alter the mozilla database : impa.gmail.com ....to....imap.googlemail.com I could not find the mozilla database, so I opened Account Settings/server settings, and changed the server name from : imap.gmail.com ....to... imap.googlemail.com

I need to receive emails to my email address destined for the two folders in question...Linux.org and the guardian....which I will definately have from Linux .org in the next few hours, and from the guardian maybe sometime this afternoon and if not definitely by 7:15am tomorrow morning. The time as i type this is 10:56am...guardian mail has already been received for today

If you have any alternative solution/thought, I will be most pleased to hear from you.

if my 'solution" works then this is definitely a google problem, not Thunderbird......but as usual thunderbird and others will be left to clean up their mess.

Edit to Add: I re enabled the Linux.org filter, and also changed its name from Info@Linux.org, to linux.org....and so far there is not another error thrown when I click on 'run now' in message filters....and the same applies to the guardian. Fingers Crossed !

Specs: Linux Mint 22 (Cinnamon) Thunderbird for linux Mint, mint-001 - 1.0 Thunderbird: 128.3.0esr (64bit)
creator: condobloke1

title: Ideas and problems with email, still after 20 years?
content:
Sending email daily, these problems has been nagging me for 20-30 years. And I still don't have a solution. That's why would be grateful if someone could make me smarter, i beliewe there are solutions that i don't know of

1.st problem: You send email that is important, then wait for reply. It never comes. You forget about this. Matter stays unresolved. Receiving/Reading confirmations are like opposite of this and they don't help. There should be something like add checkbox "Expecting a reply in a 1 or 3 days" And if reply does not come, email client would show this email discussion in a list and notification also so you could call or send again. Automatically take off checkbox if receiver will reply no there is not just massive amount of extra work. Is there a solution for this?

2.st problem: 2 or 3 persons will read the same inbox. There should be labels "a doing" "done" "waiting" that goes into IMAP so that other people using that IMAP inbox would also get updated tags of who is caring of the matter and what's it's situation is. Available tags and their colours should also be synched between each client. Yes I'm using labels, but are they imap or just local?

3.st problem: sometimes need to add a note to email, for myself. This is really nicely already solved in tb with Xnote. Would be nice ofcourse if this be also IMAP and not just local

title: "Inbox" folder automatically created every day
content:
Good morning, We use Thunderbird in the office on a computer with Windows 11, to manage several POP3 mailboxes. for a few weeks, every day some "inbox" folders are automatically created, numbered in sequence. For example Inbox-1, inbox-2, inbox-3 etc. Inside these folders, there are emails that have already been read and replied to, and therefore they seem to be duplicates of the emails already present in the normal inbox.

I had tried to remove and re-enter the account in an attempt to solve the problem, with the result that all the emails had disappeared (including in the webmail, Aruba), and I had to recover everything through the local folders that we had saved for backups.

I would like to point out that updates automatically. What is the cause of this problem? Thank you for your help.

As soon as possible, I will also publish some photos for demonstration.

title: The Ubuntu package support is broken
content:
On Ubuntu 24.04.1 LTS: The package system is broken Check if you are using third party repositories. If so disable them, since they are a common source of problems. [No: fresh snap install] Furthermore, run the following command in a Terminal: [sudo] apt-get install -f 

 Reading package lists... Done  Building dependency tree... Done  Reading state information... Done  0 upgraded, 0 newly installed, 0 to remove and 7 not upgraded.  [seems fine]

Transaction failed: The package system is broken The following packages have unmet dependencies: thunderbird-locale-en: Depends thunderbird (>= 2:1snap1-0ubuntu3) but 1:115.13.0+build5-0ubuntu022.04.1 is installed thunderbird-locale-en-us: Depends thunderbird (>= 2:1snap1-0ubuntu3) but 1:115.13.0+build5-0ubuntu022.04.1 is installed [So I have an outdated version of the library. I don't know why. thunderbird was installed after upgrade from 24.04.1LTS with snap. How do I correct this? It seems not to affect thunderbird, but the OS update fails.]

title: Auto Select First Message in Inbox
content:
I recently converted from Windows Live Mail to Thunderbird with reasonably good results. I am able to do virtually everything I previously could do with WLM, and converting all prior emails and ng messages went more smoothly than I expected.

There is one minor thing I could do with WLM (and OE before that) that I can't quite seem to do with T'Bird. With both WLM and now TB, I like having my Inbox arranged in reverse date order with a Message Pane on the bottom half of the screen that displays the contents of a selected message. The difference is that with WLM, the system would automatically default to my Inbox and select the top (most recent message) whenever I started the program or switched from newsgroup display to emails, showing the contents of the top message in the Preview Pane. With TB, I can get it to default to the Inbox, but it doesn't automatically select the first message. Instead, it shows me the list of messages on the top half of the display but the message pane contents are empty until I manually select the top message.

I did a quick search and found an Add-on to Auto-Select Latest Message, which sounds like exactly what I need, but it says it's only good for versions through 104, and I am at 115 something.

Is there a current way of achieving what I am trying to do? It's kind of a small point, but still a bit annoying when you have been doing things a certain way for the last 30 years or so.
creator: rwm6

title: All incoming emails are automatically being marked as read?
content:
Hi.

I am running Thunderbird 128.3.1esr (32-bit) on Windows 10 (64 bit).

I have a number of Thunderbird email accounts, set up with three different email services. The following issue occurs on all of the accounts with one of those services, but not on the accounts with the others (Gmail, for example, is OK). The problem occurs only on IMAP accounts, not on POP accounts.

The issue: On arrival, the status for new emails is initially shown as Unread. However, within a few minutes the status changes to Read. This occurs without opening the email, and even without highlighting it in the Inbox. It will still occur even if none of the problem accounts are open or highlighted.

The problem only occurs if Thunderbird is open. If Thunderbird is closed, emails remain Unread on my phone until I open them.

I have tried turning off my phone, but this has no effect: the email status continues to change to Read if Thunderbird is open.

I have checked Thunderbird Settings. Historically, under the Reading & Display section, emails were set to be marked as Read immediately on display. I have now turned off the “Automatically mark messages as read” section completely. This has had no impact.

The problem began a few days ago. Until then, there had been no issues. I didn’t change any settings prior to the problem’s occurrence.

Can anyone help please?

Thank you.
creator: pta124

title: Where is all my emails?

title: Clicking Inbox does not display email except after clicking some other folder first
content:
Frequently, when I click on the Inbox folder the email contents are not displayed. However, this only happens for the first account in the list, AND, clicking on the inbox works normally if I first click on some other folder and then return to the Inbox. I switched the order of the accounts in my list and found out that the problem only happens for the first account. Clicking on the Inbox for other accounts yields normal behavior (shows the message contents).

Any hints? It's a minor annoyance.
creator: gredden

title: How can I  show a  local folder on my cellphone?
content: I have several Thunderbird Local Folders when I look at my computer (Windows 11) but they don't appear on my cellphone. How can I add selected Local Folders to my cellphone when I open Thunderbird there? All other Thunderbird email accounts and local folders appear properly on my cellphone. Thanks.
creator: rbb4
